content.description: Follow the obvious crack system up the wall.  The first two moves are the crux.  Top out and scramble back down further to the east.
content.location: Located on the short wall above the main wall of the Watchtower Crag.  Head directly north from the top of the main wall.  Veggie Pile is the furthest east crack system on this wall.

content.description: Follow the obvious ledge from the lower left to the middle right of the route, then ascend the right-facing crack system.
content.protection: A large pine tree makes a great anchor at the very top of the crag.  Twenty foot slings for TR.
content.location: The route is at the southwest corner of the crag.  A good scrambling location is just around the bend from the route on the west side of the crag.

content.description: The first move is a reachy step-jump to a solid, horizontal crimp.  Match hands in the crack and shimmy them up as the crack runs up and to the right.  The quality of handholds gets worse higher on the crack.  The crux is the dyno to the top of the first ledge; afterwards, the climb gets significantly easier.
content.protection: A large pine tree makes a great anchor at the very top of the crag. Twenty foot slings for TR.
content.location:
Located to the left of

Peanut Butter Bucket

, where the wall becomes a broken slab.
